rComments: A really, really bad professor. Believe your gut around this person, she's not to be trusted
Study by yourself rather than play for her : she's useless, potentially even rly harmful

Koga is the worst, most disappointing person on the faculty. Ruins her students' hands and any possibility they could have a career. Shameful, bordering on disgraceful, abusive treatment of students. Cannot handle any criticism or challenging of her position, which is based on connections and has nothing to do with her playing (which is awful).
A joke of a prof, politically motivated and deceitful. A true disappointment with nothing real to offer, and possessive as hell. Run away from her.
The least she could do would be to try to learn how to play the piano.
Midori is extremely kind, compassionate and caring. She is always exploring new ways to help her students improve.

It's incredible that someone like Midori is dubbed a professor when there are so many great pianists in Toronto who know how to teach the piano and don't need a pedagogy degree to do it, because they just know music and they know how to play.  Just listen to her play anything from the standard literature, and you won't want to study with her.
She has good ideas about tension but is a bit on the political side so you really have to watch out.

Midori is awesome!  I love my lessons.  She's tough as nails but super helpful, and helps you learn to hear.  She can be really feisty too, make sure you have done all your practicing and have a good reason if you haven't.  Her ideas are really smart and she opens your technique to be able to compute what you conceptualize.  Great prof.
